definition: false/untrue to one's convictions/against one's will/disloyal
to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
false assertion/speech against one's own convictions

sentences.english: This is, of course, a counterintuitive argument.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個讓所有人感到違心的論斷。

sentences.english: You are endeavouring to disarm me by reason, and to convince me against my will.
sentences.chinese: 你是在設法說服我，讓我違心地接受你的看法。

sentences.english: He said no father ever forces his daughter to marry against her will.
sentences.chinese: 他說沒有任何一個父親曾經強迫他的女兒違心地嫁人。

sentences.english: Don't allow yourself to be subject to peer pressure or encouraged to do something that you don't want to do.
sentences.chinese: 不要屈服於壓力，也不要違心地做自己不想做的事。

sentences.english: Wish you happiness, I must say.
The seventh time when she sang a song of praise and deemed it a virtue.
sentences.chinese: 第七次，當它違心的大唱讚歌時，卻將其看做美德。

sentences.english: According to my opinion, sub-building is probably fair view.
sentences.chinese: 據我的意見，子建大概是違心之論。

sentences.english: He bludgeoned me into doing something which I didn't want to do.
sentences.chinese: 他不斷強迫我去做一些違心的事。
